terms.definition: A rate statistic that scales output to a 90-minute match so players with different minutes can be compared fairly.
Total playing time. High totals can reflect durability or role; always pair with per-90 rates for context.
An efficiency indicator showing how often a shot becomes a goal. Useful alongside shot volume.
Percentage of shots that are on target. A quick proxy for finishing quality and decision making.
Shot volume normalized to a full match. Highlights how often a player gets attempts.
How often a player gets touches in the penalty area. Often correlated with goal involvement.
An estimate of scoring probability based on shot quality, location, and context. Used to separate chance quality from finishing.
An estimate of the likelihood a pass becomes an assist based on chance quality. Useful for evaluating creative output.
The tactical job a player performs (e.g., target striker, pressing winger). Role changes how stats should be interpreted.
Volume reflects how often actions occur (shots/90), while efficiency reflects how well they convert (goals per shot).
